column5: Yes and the gas is/was cheaper there than in the Falls

WE HAVE BEEN GOING UP I29 INTO CANADA FOR QUITE A FEW YEARS. NEVER HAD ANY REAL TROUBLE...IT TAKES 10 TO 15 MIN. PER TRUCK/BOAT- AND WERE ON OUR WAY..IS ALL THIS TALK ABOUT INT.FALLS GOING TO CARRY OVER TO OUR CROSSING.. WILL BE LEAVEING OMAMH SEPT.12TH. AT 6PM..SHOULD PUT US THERE ABOUT 3-4 A.M.THE 13TH..ALSO, WHAT IS THIS TALK ABOUT PAYING (FOR A CAR-TRUCK/BOAT)WE NEVER HAVE IN 14YRS..IS THIS NEW??? KEEP YOUR LINES WET..JIM
The crossing at International Falls/Fort Francis is where they are waiting in lines, and paying to cross the bridge. As I understand it, the bridge is owned by the paper company, thus the charge.

At that hour of the morning I doubt that you are going to have much of a delay. Yes there is a toll bridge there. It's been that way for 50 years that I can remember. Cannot recall the exact charge but it's less than 2 bucks.

I got back last week. We crossed Int'l Falls on a Thursday and came back on a Monday. There was a $10 charge for a truck and boat on a trailer. We didn't wait in line either time and crossed in the afternoon.
The toll is $10 US, and we only had to pay it when we went into Canada. Last year it was something like $4.50 in either US or Canadian funds, payable going both ways.IaCraig
I just got back tonight, went into Ontario last Sunday. The toll was C$9.00 or US$5.00 - I gave the girl nine loonies left over from last year. So I don't know where this US$10 number is coming from.

Intl. Falls crossing has always charged toll and the bridge is owned by Boise Cascade Paper. The charge is now $10.00 on the way up in US funds but you don't pay coming back. I pull a boat it might be cheaper with just a car or truck.
I got back yesterday from Kenora.The charge for a pickup and boat is $10 from US to Canada.No toll the other way.

For those of you that go up frequently, or are going up in a Caravan, there's a gas station just south of Int'l Falls that sits right on the corner of a right hand bend in the highway, on the left hand side, sorry can't remember the name. Anyway, tell the you would like to buy a border crossing card. For $10 they will sell you a card that is good for six crossings during the course of the year (you still have to pay the toll for the trailer)but if there are 2 or 3 cars in your caravan you can use the card to get all of them across. Sorry if this isn't worded will but it's tough to explainPaul[email protected]
Found the name. It's called the Korner Kwik Stop
